definition: rough sketch (of a painting)/(of an official) to approve a document by signing it
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]

sentences.english: He fills in a sketch with shadow.
sentences.chinese: 他在画稿上添衬上阴影。

sentences.english: Please find enclosed :the artwork of the card.
sentences.chinese: 请在附件中查阅卡片的“画稿”。

sentences.english: Following photos are original works , all web_photos could be set orders.
sentences.chinese: 以下图片均为实物原作拍摄，所有画稿均可下订单。

sentences.english: Students consummate their designs by knowledge just learned.
sentences.chinese: 学生根据所学进行设计完善，修改自己画稿。

sentences.english: NO1, the first step is to design small-scale drawings.
sentences.chinese: 第一步是设计小型画稿。

definition: to copy (a model of calligraphy or painting etc)
to make a draft/to draft (a document)
fine writing paper, originally from Jing county 涇縣|泾县, Xuancheng 宣城, Anhui
gongbi, traditional Chinese painting method characterized by meticulous brush technique and detailed description
to draw/picture/painting/CL:幅[fu2],張|张[zhang1]/classifier for paintings etc/variant of 劃|划[hua4]
